descp: This course introduces students to the basic components of electronics: diodes, transistors, and op amps.  It covers the basic operation and some common applications.

course-name: Circuits and Electronics 1: Basic Circuit Analysis
descp: Learn techniques that are foundational to the design of microchips used in smartphones, self-driving cars, computers, and the Internet.
The course introduces the fundamentals of the lumped circuit abstraction. Design and lab exercises are also significant components of the course.

course-name: Soft Electronics for Maternal, Fetal and Neonatal Health
descp: Stanford University offers a short lecture by Professor John Rogers on the application of soft electronics in maternal, fetal, and neonatal health.
Learn about cool applications, op-amps and filters in the design of microchips used in smartphones, self-driving cars, computers, and the internet.

course-name: Circuits and Electronics 2: Amplification, Speed, and Delay
descp: Learn how to speed up digital circuits and build amplifiers in the design of microchips used in smartphones, self-driving cars, computers, and the Internet.

Introduction to Digital Electronics.Switch and Bits Intuition.Introduction to Number Systems.Decimal to Octal Conversion.Octal to Decimal Conversion.Hexadecimal to Binary Conversion.Gray Code to Binary conversion.Hamming Code | Error detection.Logic Gate…

course-name: Arduino Course for Beginners - Open-Source Electronics Platform
descp: Learn the basics of Arduino, from understanding electronics foundations to programming and using the Arduino board. Offered by a renowned open-source electronics platform.
Dive into circuits and electronics with this 17-week MIT course. Learn circuit design, digital logic, and signal processing at your own pace, with interactive videos, labs, and quizzes.
Learn the principles of power electronics and how to analyze and design efficient converter circuits. Offered by University of Colorado Boulder.

Electronics is fundamental to modern life. Using an interactive website, videos, and easy-to-use electronic circuit design and simulation software, this free course, An introduction to electronics,...

course-name: Fundamentals of Audio and Music Engineering: Part 1 Musical Sound & Electronics
descp: Learn the basics of acoustics and electronics to understand musical sound and create music with electronic instruments. Offered by University of Rochester.
Learn advanced VLSI design with NPTEL's 44-hour program. Gain insights into CMOS circuits, low power design techniques, hardware description languages, VLSI testing, and design verification.
Master power electronics and industrial drives with NPTEL's 33-hour program. Learn about controlled rectifiers, converters, DC motor speed control, and more.
Learn the basics of electronics and how to incorporate them into rapid prototypes in this 5-week course from Arizona State University. Explore electric circuits, motors, and microcontrollers.
